origination.corpname: Washington State University. International Project. Support Office

did.unittitle: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University International Project Support Office Lesotho Reports
did.abstract: Research records related to agricultural projects in Lesotho conducted by WSU and USAID.

bioghist.p: In 1978, the International Program Development Office was established in the Graduate School of WSU to direct international development projects. At that time, the University was involved in several projects, with major efforts in Indonesia, Lesotho, and a cooperative project in Sudan.

scopecontent.p: A collection of research reports on the role of agriculture, specific plants, and the cattle market in Lesotho primarily from 1983-1984. Additional reports from 1981 and 1986 mixed within.

arrangement.p: This is an unprocessed collection. Any arrangement reflects either a pre-existing order from the records' creators or previous custodians, or preliminary sorting performed by staff.
Contains reports and research projects mostly relating to the state of agriculture, horticulture, and cattle from the South African country Lesotho. In mostly chronological order from 1983-1984.

accessrestrict.p: This collection is open and available for research use.

prefercite.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University International Project Support Office Lesotho Reports, 1983-1984 (UA1989-25)
Manuscripts, Archives, and Special Collections, Washington State University Libraries, Pullman, WA.

acqinfo.p: This material was transferred to WSU Libraries' MASC by Mary Weitz of the International Project Support Office on August 30, 1989 and retained as UA1989-25.

relatedmaterial.p: Preliminary Guide to the Washington State University International Project Support Office Lesotho Project Files, 1979-1988 (UA1988-18)
Smaller folder-level Lesotho-related materials can be found in various collections.

controlaccess.p: This collection is indexed under the following headings in the online catalog. Researchers desiring materials about related topics, persons, or places should search the catalog using these headings.
